title: Docker
content:
Chapter 1 Docker archive An archive of things I need to remember about Docker.
 Docker Run Cheatsheet  A collection of ‘docker run’ examples for starting containers

title: Hawko's Blog
content: Welcome Welcome to my blog. I just need to dump things out of my head and keep them somewhere semi-permanent so when I change employer or lose a hard drive I don’t lose this information.

title: Docker Run Cheatsheet
content:
I can never remember how to start these things properly Splunk Enterprise docker run -d -p 8000:8000 -e "SPLUNK_START_ARGS=--accept-license" -e "SPLUNK_PASSWORD=<password>" --name splunk splunk/splunk:latest  https://splunk.github.io/docker-splunk/ADVANCED.html  Splunk Universal Forwarder docker run -d -p 9997:9997 -e "SPLUNK_START_ARGS=--accept-license" -e "SPLUNK_PASSWORD=<password>" --name uf splunk/universalforwarder:latest To access the UF container, do this:
docker exec -it -u splunk uf /bin/bash -c "/opt/splunkforwarder/bin/splunk status"
